description: I came to Aquitaine for a glass of wine, and was pleased with the relaxed atmosphere. I had a glass of red during happy hour at the bar. I did not partake in the food specials, but they were tempting. Jordy, the bartender at the time, was knowledgable. Best of all, I wasn't rushed to finished my glass of wine or order anything beyond the one glass. I'll be back durning my next trip to the city!
author: Valerie N.

description: Went here with my gf yesterday. The food here was really good but kind of pricey, I had the polenta, fries, and steak. Everything was really romantic with the lit candle in the middle of the table, the dim lighting adding to the mood, and the nice ambience. The service was really good and they were very attentive and checked up on us often.
author: Thang D.

description: Went with some colleagues for a team lunch. Had the Duck Reuben; it was delicious. The serving time was a bit long, but the atmosphere was very nice. The clogs they serve their appetisers in are cute!
author: Yves L.

description:
You ever want to go somewhere and feel transplanted into another place? The kind of place that when you leave the reality hits that you haven't gone anywhere and you almost scramble back in the door. This is that kind of place. 

I've been to France, never this region but, I can feel Aquitaine's authenticity. It's starts with the decor, extends to the menu and finished with the sommelier, Andrew.

The multitude of times that j have been here it never disappoints. The eggplant is incredible, polenta is amazing and the duck presentation will knock your socks off. Even with a smaller menu now the food excels, even the deviled eggs are a must. 

Oh and please when you're there enjoy the sommelier's knowledge of wine and perfect pairings. You will not be disappointed.
author: Kennan S.

description:
This place was extremely empty when we came in on a Monday night, which would normally signal that I should keep walking. We tried it out though, and I'm so glad we did.
Our server was so excellent, chatty and helpful! The wine list had some lovely items, including a very enjoyable sparkling rosé. We had a lovely cold cucumber soup, cassoulet that had a fantastic broth and very unusual and delicious sausage, and scallops served in such a pretty formation it was almost a shame to eat them (glad I did!). Cheese and Sauternes for dessert rounded out a delicious evening.
Convenient location in downtown/Financial District, and I bet it's pretty lively for lunch. I'll update if I get there for lunch one day!
author: Deborah M.

description:
We had a wonderful family get together last night with my cousin and his family.  My 87 year old mother is from Québec and anytime her family is in the area, we try to meet.  I chose this restaurant because of her.

If you do have a large group they have a private room called La Cave which you can reserve ahead of time.  I wish I had known this when I made the reservation, because i would have definitely asked for it for our group of eight.  Maybe the restaurant could advise a large party to choose it.  We arrived at the end of end of Happy Hour and it was noisy on the main floor but definitely did quiet down later. We were in the center of the room so I hope we did not annoy the couples who were around us.

We started with a Sauvignon Blanc and a bottle of red wine, both were wonderful, along with two orders each of deviled eggs and mussels.  Because of allergy issues, we requested the mussels to be made without the cream that is usually used.  They were amazingly wonderful!  My mother ate them like candy.  We weren't as wild about the deviled eggs though they are interesting.  They had too much "stuff" in them and a whole cherry tomato pinned on top. Also some spice mixed in that was a bit strange.   I grew up in the South so this makes me very particular about deviled eggs I guess.

For entrées four of our group ordered the lamb for two (house specialty), two ordered the divers scallops, one the duck confit, and one the steak.  This was after much dithering!  We all ended up tasting all the dishes so I can report my thoughts:

1.  Lamb - totally delicious!  Comes with a polenta with ratatouille that is to die for, and the sauce too.

2.  Ditto for the steak.  The green peppercorn sauce was very "Peppery."  The steak was tender and I ate all the potatoes (well, my brother is supposedly low carb, right?)

3.  Divers scallops - mixed feelings.  My Mom did not really like hers, but she did eat one whole "shell" and all 3 scallops.  They come in three large shells that have the scallop on the end and the melon mix in the shell.  It is kind of like a salad.  The whole thing is served on kelp which some of us tried nibbling on.  I liked mine a lot (scallop dish, not the kelp).  Maybe Mom was just stuffed on the mussels . . . .?

4.  Duck confit - two pieces of duck with a delicious sauce and large beans and mushrooms.  I would order this one next time.  My tastes of hubby's dish were very tantalizing.

The service throughout the meal was very attentive and helpful.

Although we were too full for dessert we did order the île flottant, the chocolate molten cake, and the peach dish.  I tried the first two and they were divine.  Maybe the best one was my husband's cheese plate.  For $8 he got a choice of one cheese, walnut brittle, a thin biscuit with honey, and grapes.  It was really, really good.  The waiter had us try two dessert wines, one a pinkish one that I loved, and another red one that was the general fave.

Merci beaucoup Aquitaine pour un dîner assez merveilleux!  It was a great place for a French-Canadian rendezvous!
author: Michele H.

description: The trout is amazing. I've come here twice now after work and have gotten it both times. The ambience is very nice too.
author: Shane W.

description: This downtown French bistro is casual, kind of dark and romantic, somewhat loud but the corner table off the bar is pretty intimate.  You can easily get a table for a late dinner...I went about 9pm there were only 2-3 other tables filled.  The food is delicious and they happily made some changes to accommodate my dietary needs. Not only were the wines by the glass unique and well priced but they really wanted to make sure the wines worked with what we were eating; they allowed me to try a few before I made a selection that I was quite happy with.  They also have an interesting space downstairs that you can rent out for small gatherings.  This is a rare place: friendly staff, warm decor, amazing food and great wine.  I only wish it were closer to me so I could go more often!
author: Melani R.

description: Tried this place, right near FiDi and Union Square, for the first time tonight. Love it! Very cozy and cute inside - lots of two tops, candles lit on every table. I thought I'd have one glass of wine and an appetizer (they have a charcuterie board and salads or side dishes that look good). Instead I had the flatiron steak and an order of pomme frites. The steak was perfectly cooked to order (I asked for medium and I got medium - yay!) with lots of roasted, tender carrots, parsnips and onions. I'd come back and order that again. Fries were too big in the order for me to eat but they were served hot and crispy in a Dutch wodden shoe. They paired nicely with the steak - maybe next time I'll ask for a half order of fries as I couldn't eat the whole shoe of them on my own. Excellent service - all male and friendly. And the wines by the glass list is long and well-priced. You'll find something you like for under $18 per glass, which doesn't happen often in this neighborhood. Casual, lively, warm and they make you feel like a welcome local. Definitely check this place out if you're feeling French after a long day at work or shopping!
author: Sonya S.

description: What an oasis! Service is amazing, food excellent and the wine is divine!! If you are looking for a place for a lovely lunch or dinner this is the place for you. They even have a private dining room that seats 20.
author: Ruby S.

description: The steak we ordered was perfectly cooked and the duck tender and juicy. Ask your server for wine recommendations, ours was knowledgeable, and we had a nice pairing for our meal.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Really disappointing meal I had while visiting SF. 

Dec 11th around 6:00 p.m. Dinner. Party: 1. Service was OK. At least they are sincere. Food: bad.

Appetizer: Octopus. A salad like dish with arugula. The octopus was extremely sour. Feels like I am drinking vinegar straight from the bottle. 

Talked to the server and then manager talked to me and explained octopus was marinated with lemon juice and cherry vinigerette. Ok.

Manager came to ask me if I'm ready for my check then I told him I have another course.

Seared White albacore Tuna: I waited for another 30 minutes for this. The restaurant was not even full yet. The fish was entirely cold. I know it's seared but there should be some warmth. On top of that the portion was so small and most importantly It doesn't even taste good. Like previous yelper said their dishes takes bland.

Manager came to apologize and offer me a small desert which I didn't take. I paid and left. 

I can feel the manager was trying to make things right but too bad it's the worst French cuisine I've ever had.
author: H G.

description:
Like the atmosphere and the wine/beer selection. Not sure if there is a happy hour but will be back.

Quick response re: Happy Hour. Will be back sooner. Thank you!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Great pork chop special and, the steak frittes with Roquefort were perfectly cooked med rare and had amazing flavor. The service was great and the wine suggestions were great pairs to our meal! We will be back!!
author: David S.

description:
Stylish yet cosy french bistro, had a delicious lunch with some colleagues - deviled eggs and roe, pomme-frites (amusingly served in a wood clog! the whole place is designed around Van Goug's Sunflowers), and a superbly prepared bavette steak as an entree.

The servers were delightful and skilled, didn't try to push any specials or "cocktails of the day" on us. All in all a wonderful afternoon! highly recommended as a lunch spot.
author: Shaul H.

description: What a lovely place! The service was prompt and friendly, and we ordered the octopus, muscles and deviled eggs. All food was delicious and we were surprised by how large the muscles portion was. They even offered to serve us extra bread for the leftover broth in our muscles dish which was so appreciated! Malbec and syrah wines were great. Only downside was it is a big cramped in some of the table seating, but certainly worth it! The ambiance is also super relaxing with creative accents Iike a wine glass and bottle chandelier, with some wine cork covering the crown molding as well.
author: Katie N.

description:
This place is a hidden gem. We made a reservation online a couple hours before going in and were seated right away. 

The service was good. I could tell that the server was either from France or had some french background as he was explaining the wines and foods. The authenticity of the service definitely made the experience more enjoyable. My only complaint is that the server forgot about us once dinner was served and we had to ask for the bill from the food runner (who was amazingly helpful!). 

We took the server's recommendation on a bottle of wine and were surprised that the way he explained it was exactly as it taste. The food was great. We ordered an appetizer, entrees, and dessert and do not have one bad remark. To top it off, we felt like the prices for each dish were fair in comparison to other restaurants in the area. 

Overall, we had an amazing time and definitely recommend going! We went on a Friday night and were surprised that the place wasn't packed with people, but I think that's what makes this place even better.
author: Kendra W.

description:
This is my absolute favorite after work wine spot (only partially due to location, almost entirely due to their amazing popcorn which is served in a wooden clog). As I've made it my goal to eat at every non-movie theater establishment that services popcorn, I can confidently say this is one of my favorites to do so at. The wine is good too, I usually get one of the sparkly ones.

Their upstairs area is a typical smattering of tables and chairs (and some high-top barrels which offer cute ambiance), while downstairs hosts couches and armchairs. As my friend pointed out this week, "It feels quite a bit like I'm in my own living room, only someone else is serving me. And it's awesome." I quite agree. 

Extra bonus? Chalkboard lining the wall of the bathroom.
author: Alicia O.

description:
Vegetarians! Order the Escantoun Landais (Polenta with Mushrooms, Pyrenees Cheese, Bordelaise Sauce). Amazing!

Also, it has a nice ambiance and the staff was very friendly.
author: Michelle L.

description: We arrived at 7:30 for Valentine's day dinner.  The place was packed.  We had to wait a little for our table but the atmosphere was wonderful, the staff was polite and apologetic about running late.  I ordered the deviled eggs (which were fantastic!) and the salmon.  My husband ordered the Valentine's day special which included oysters, a sausage and scallops course, then shrimp and steak.  The shrimp were huge and delicious, the steak was good but not as great as the shrimp.  The wine pairings were incredible!  Some of the best wine I've ever had. The dessert also had a wonderful wine pairing.  All in all, I would recommend to friends and we intend to come back with friends.
author: Patty S.

description:
Stumbled upon this cute little wine bar on Sutter street after a long Tuesday. Great place to come after work or meet a few friends for a few mid-week drinks. We didn't have any trouble walking in and getting seated right away! 

The atmosphere is adorable and appropriate for a French wine bar.  The seating is quite tight in some areas so expect to be squeezing in between people to get to your seat. The service was great and both of our waiters were very sweet.  They explained the menu and picked good wine for us to drink! 


FOOD: 
Mussels Appetizer: very good! came in a black pot with ~ 20 mussels that were cooked well.  The bread had some sort of pesto sauce on it so that was a good complement.
Cassoulet: Duck Confit, Toulouse Sausage, White Beans.  I wasn't much of a fan.  The sausage was soft but not much taste and there wasn't a lot of duck. 
Iles Flottantes/Floating Island Meringue, Crème Anglaise: very very very light dessert.  It's just a slice of Meringue on top of some sweet creme....but very good! 

Overall, 4 stars for ambiance, service, and wine.
author: Kristin C.

description: Had really high expectations based on an article we read on top Union Square restaurants. The service was very good. Friendly and helpful staff. Strong wine list with some nice options. The Rousanne/Grenache white was a nice surprise. But honestly a bit underwhelmed by the food. My halibut was a bit small and dry. The deviled eggs were okay but not great as others have rated. Roasted quail was tasty but the plate presentation was all brown with the marinated peaches. Needed some other colors and flavors. Maybe some vegetables?
author: David S.

description: I really liked this place. Unpretentious quality country French food. I had the cassoulet and my husband had the pork belly and scallops dish. Both get a thumbs up. We also ordered all the sides...polenta, Pommes frites and Brüssel sprouts. Our eyes were way too big for our stomachs but we enjoyed everything. Our 8 year old strongly agrees.
author: Kirsten F.

description: fries were ok. I've had better. The burger was thick and very meaty. The sautéed onions had a strange flavor when mixed with the beef patty but alone, the sautéed onions tasted better. I'm glad the pickled mayonnaise sauce was on the side. I like Boss Burger better. The owner/manager and waiters were very attentive and checked in with us often. Service deserves 4-5 stars. Ambience and décor very cozy and comfortable. Location very good.
author: K V.

description:
Aquitaine is by far one of the cutest places I've ever been to in the city for eating out.

SERVICE---
When my friend and I first arrived, we were seated at the bar and told that a table would open up for us. When a table did open up, our other friends told us that they were going to be late. We thought that was an issue, but the waiter/hostess was OK with seating us anyway -- that was a pleasant surprise.

It was the personality of the waiters was robotic.
1) The waiters would pour our wine into our glasses and B-line it to the next table even though we had requests or wanted to order things. This was done several times and the waiter even noticed that he had walked away during the middle of my request because he walked back after serving another table. 
2) The waiter took my glass with my extra wine without me noticing. Did he/she take the rest of my wine away or did he/she pour it into my glass? I'll never know.

FOOD---
The mussels ($14) were tasty and came with the amount one would expect. It was a wine and tomato based sauce though, so take note. 

The polenta with mushrooms ($16) was delicious, however, I'm not certain I would pay that much for polenta with the way it was cooked and presented.

The lollipop chicken ($17) was disappointing and a bit gimmicky. The restaurant basically scraped off the meat on the bottom of the bone and made the chicken into a lollipop that was deep fried with potatoes and other things I couldn't identify in the dark. The dish didn't look too appealing though. The waitress mentioned that this was a good dish to order if you were hungry, but I didn't think it had much taste. 

Maybe we just ordered some of the wrong things.
author: Christina L.

description:
Cozy place but super loud in the front unless you sit at the bar.

The food is quite good. 3.5 stars. I had the Bordeaux blend by the glass and it was excellent (Bordeaux Blend, Château Guibot Fourvieille, St. Emilion 2009)

Serrano Ham, Tomatoes, Garlic Tartines -- Serrano ham was great but the Tartines are way to hard to bite into.

The fried calamari was great, slightly spicy, very light -- I would highly recommend.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
This little gem in the Financial District is a great kept secret. I'm sure it's busier on weekdays, but on weekends it was a romantic setting.

Their service is wonderful and explained any of our questions about the menu.

Foie Gras on the menu is a sure bet they know what they are doing. 

Cheese plate on the dessert section is another way of knowing this place is for real.

Yes, it's not La Folie, they are experimental taste French. This place is home style little cafe in Le Marais French food. 

If you are lactose intolerant like me, say, fuck it. Enjoy that cheese.

Would list and food were wonderful!
author: David R.

description: Excellent food, wine and service.  Great atmosphere and background music (jazz, French).  We will be back!
author: Ellen W.

description: My best friend and I come here regularly, and we've celebrated her birthday at Aquintaine two years in a row - Amazing service, friendly staff, and exceptional food and drinks. Everything was top-notch. Andrew and Leo are amazing! I highly recommend it to everyone, for a big group and a nice solo evening on a date.
author: Sariya A.

description:
Quaint little wine bar in the FiDi. I am not a wine guy and was there more for the food. I had the KöPi which is a light German beer.  We ordered some small plates. The chicken lollipop was so so but the polenta was incredible.

Interesting to note that they have a blackboard and chalk in the restroom for customers to use and the messages were all positive. Made me smile.
author: Sunil R.

description: Service and food was superb! Fresh and tasty though pricey given portion size, as well as when compared to other similar restaurants in city.
author: Amit R.

description: I ordered a fried cod salad. It was ok, but not the best I've ever had and also pretty expensive. The menu didn't have much of a selection, but the ambiance was nice. I'd give it 4 stars if I didn't think it was so overpriced.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Cute little spot in FiDi and Union Square border.  It's warm and inviting; comfortable like you want to relax, but not like an overstuffed sofa from PB.

They hit the sweet spot of being a good place to take a date and where you can go with friends and not feel surrounded by couples playing footsie under the table.
author: Chloe M.

description: Excellent food, great service. Wine selection is phenomenal. The cheese plate desert is a must have.  If you like French food, this is the place for you.
author: Jay S.

description: We must have hit an off night. When I asked what wine would pair nicely with the duck confit, the waiter immediately cocked his hips in one direction, his head in the other, and rudely proceeded to dress me down for not knowing exactly what wine I preferred. So rude in fact that we left the restaurant. Seemed to fall pretty far from a 2015 Zagat award.
author: Jen S.

description: This place is overrated. Or maybe they are 4 star for their lunch menu. We went for dinner. The duck dish is awful. It is a bowl of cheap red bean with fatty smelling sausage, and some plastic texture leg of duck. Didn't eat the sausage nor the duck. Paid $30 for a bowl of red bean!
author: newsha m.

description: Great hearty French food. Lamb shank was really awesome. Garbure is an interesting duck stew. And really interesting chandeliers.
author: Yh G.

description:
Very nice place to go to after work to unwind.  The food wasn't bad and the prices were reasonable.  The Duck Confit Stew was so so.  But the deviled eggs are an absolute must.

The service was great and the restaurant had a warm feel to it.

A big plus was the lounge downstairs.  We took our dessert downstairs and had a nice place to just sit and chat for a long time.  The waiter and even the Manager were perfect hosts and just allowed us uninterrupted privacy.  

I will be coming back definitely for the lounge.
author: Edward M.

description:
Went for lunch with a friend. Was not too crowded (Tuesday at noon), noise level was reasonable, easy to have a conversation.
I had the cassoulet - it took a little while to arrive, not excessively so, but a bit surprising for lunchtime in the area. However, it was cold, tasted bland, and was really no better than canned cassoulet. Very disappointing.

Service was fine, but we both came out agreeing that we would not come back, as the price did not match the quality.
author: Olivier L.

description:
What a lovely place this was!!
The customer service was great! The food was extraordinary and the wine collection was amazing. 
This is a hidden gem in my neighborhood and I highly recommend it!!
Fresh seasonal produce with the right amount of spices and not too greasy!! Very flavorful.
I had booked this place for a birthday celebration and they really took good care of us!!
author: Justyna R.

description: I had some time to kill before meeting up with my partner so I wandered in here for a glass of wine. I ended up enjoying their happy hour cheese plate, which was fantastic! The service was super friendly. I can't wait to come back for dinner.
author: Mark S.

description: When meeting up with friends for a Friday happy hour, we chose Aquitaine because of its Yelp reviews and wine list.  If you're a wino, this is your place.  There's tons of variety and options for wine by the bottle or by the glass.  While the place is small it's very inviting and Aquitaine does take reservations through Yelp SeatMe.  We shared the selection of fromage ($22), which included three cheeses and bread.  It's probably perfect to share for two or three people (we had 5 but at least everyone got a taste).  The pommes frites are also good for sharing and come in a wooden shoe.  Also, Aquitaine is conveniently located in FiDi, so it's a great option for lunch with friends working in the area.
author: Stephanie V.

description: Outstanding wine,  great food - French fries in a shoe! Leo was super helpful and very  knowledgeable.  We'll be back!
author: Matt B.

description: Worst service I've ever had in San Francisco. Not greeted at the entrance. Literally stood there for 5 minutes without anyone acknowledging our existence. We then thought it must be a "seat yourself" place so we grabbed menus and went to a table. Another 5 minutes passed and a rude employee came up, simply asked if we had a reservation to which we replied "no". He didn't say anything else and simply went to his computer and then to the back of the restaurant. Another 5 minutes and nobody came, so we left and went next door to Gaspar which was amazing and had superb attentive service. Is that a detailed enough review for you Andrew and Yelp? I will definitely be reaching out to you directly Andrew. When I have the time. Hopefully tomorrow. Sad that your staff is so ill trained that they don't even greet people when they walk in to your establishment. It doesn't get any more basic than that. Your menu did look great but I'm not sure what's going on with your staff. They need serious attitude adjustments or new jobs.
author: Andre J.

description: Disappointing - I want to like it more, but after a half dozen lunches and dinners there in the past few months (it's right near the office) I won't be going back. The service is friendly but inattentive (almost every meal requires asking more than once for something). The room is far too noisy when it's even close to full. The kitchen is very slow, regardless of how crowded the place is. And the food is uneven at best. Nice people, but I'd rather walk over to Belden Alley for a more reliable meal.
author: tw s.

description:
The food was mediocre (3/5), the waiter wasn't very attentive (first aggressively pressured us into getting wine, then never came back to ask for our order). In the end, the host asked us how everything was, and we gave him honest feedback "it was pretty good, not our favorite." In return for our honesty, we got a snarky question of "how old are you?" And "sometimes you don't get your favorite."

EDIT: the owner just reached out and apologized on yelp. It's probably just a one off thing that wouldn't happen again. Updating rating to 3 stars.
author: Sashko S.

description: Food was delish, but it took 45 minutes to get my sandwich and they never brought my side. Might be good for dinner, but waaay too long for lunch service.
author: Lori D.

description: Aside from the delicious wines and champagnes raved about in my previous review; the food is great too. Try the bavette salad.
author: Shondra G.

description:
I spotted Aquitane one day walking to lunch and I love French food and wine so I made note to come and check it out. My mom was in town for my birthday last year and she was starving after traveling all day so I picked Aquitane since it was close to her hotel and close to my office.  We loved everything and now every time she comes to visit she wants to meet there first thing.  Since last year I have come here at least once a week for lunch and I truly love this place!  
The atmosphere, service and food are excellent!  Andrew the owner is very attentive along with all of his staff and they truly care that you enjoy your experience.  They make regular changes to the menu so you never have a chance to get tired of anything... and even though I tend to order the same kind of dishes (soup and one of their salads) I have loved them all!  You should definitely come and check them out!
author: Halley S.

description:
Came here on a weekday with a few friends. The place tucked away on sutter so it may be a bit hard to find.

The restaurant had an European decor with a wall of wine bottles. It would be a good spot for after work drinks or dinner with a group of friends.

FOOD:
They serve quite a bit of appetizers and several larger dishes. I tried the mussels. They came in a large pot of about 15 and were quite huge. The sauce was tomato based and a little bland but decent enough.

I also ordered a glass of Cabernet franc which paired well. The restaurant also has house wine.

Service was excellent with the waiters refilling water and bring quite attentive.

If definitely come back to try more wine and some of the other food!
author: Stephen C.

description: Aquitaine has an amazing wine selection. If you're ever in doubt in terms of what wine to order, ask for Andrew,  he has an amazing palate and will undoubtedly suggest a good wine.
author: Carlos V.

description: Came here for a work dinner and was not disappointed. Delicious French classics, intriguing wines and friendly service. A bit loud for very private conversation, but would definitely come again.
author: Kathy A.

description: I liked overall experience. The entrees were yummy. (Though all the dishes I ordered needed a bit more acidity ) the decor and ambience are cozy and not too loud. Friendly service. Overall a good place to have a dinner with a friend or a date after work.
author: mona k.

description:
This place is a gem with amazing food, amazing wines at reasonable prices, and never too crowded (esp. for weekday lunch!). All of the staff including and especially Andrew the owner is really attentive and nice and cares that you like what you are getting, and asks for feedback all the time.

Andrew also always remembers what wines you liked and has something great to recommend the next time. A bonus on the wines - you can buy bottles to take home at a 30% discount, so if you really liked what you had, take some home! It's as good or a better price than you'll find elsewhere for harder to find French wines.

And be sure to stop downstairs and check out "La Cave" - if you have a large dinner party or want a place to yourself you can reserve it, and it's a wonderful private atmospheric place.

The food is just incredible... if you have a friend who likes lamb, get the 2-person lamb shank dinner entree, it's the best lamb I've had in a while. Other favorites are the cassoulet, and some of the best moules frites around.
author: Arshad T.

description: Such a wonderful spot for a private event. Andrew was great in getting is set up with a happy hour event for our 30 staff. Food was delicious, service was perfect. Cannot recommend enough!!
author: Adele A.

description: Stopped in for dinner for two and everything was great: food, wine, and service. Our favorites were the lamb for two and the riz au lait (dessert). The staff was friendly and helpful without being pushy. I would definitely go again and would recommend to others.
author: Jose G.

description:
A little piece of France downtown!

I feel lucky to have found this gem so close to work. A+ for food, wine and atmosphere!
author: Jessica B.

description:
Met a girlfriend here for happy hour one rainy day. They had a spot for our wet umbrellas which is nice :)

We got a bottle of red, some popcorn, and a little charcuterie board. I love that the popcorn comes in a clog! Such a cute and unique touch. The charcuterie board was a little small, but decent sized for happy hour. The server was sarcastic and attentive :)
author: Alexandra W.

description: Stop being a cubilce slave! Enjoy lunch, wine and the unobtrusuve music in this cozy, intimate and warm setting. Andrew has the magic touch with regards to customer service and details.
author: Reena C.

description: Fantastic French food --meat, fish and vegetarian choices--in a cozy and beautiful place made it a wonderful experience for our 3 generations of discerning eaters.
author: Rita R.

description:
Here is my story. I made a reservation at another restaurant for dinner on Friday night and then was told by one of my girlfriends on the same day that it's located in a very unsafe area that we need to find something else. And seemed like they want to eat somewhere in Union Square,  so I found here in last minute and successfully made reservation for three. I thought I did a smart move and saved our Friday girls night out. 

When I got there I saw very few people inside, which was not a good sign. Anyway, the waiter(only one who was working there I think, plus bar tender) looked friendly, so it wasn't too bad. I got the steak and my friend got duck comfit. Appetizer bread was warm and the butter was soft too. It seemed that it's a good start. 
So I got my steak. I asked for medium rare and i think it's more on the rare side. But that's not a big problem. They sliced the steak, and put it on top of two potato skin with mashed potato ground beef filling. And the steak was bland and relative cold. The worst thing was overall flavor, extremely sour!!!! I was starving, but I still found it's very unpleasant to swallow the food. I haven't had anything like this for a while and was super disappointed. And my friend who got duck comfit, said the same thing the sauce was very sour. It was such a disappointment night that we had to go somewhere else to get desert after the dinner. 

I gave it two stars because the service was not super bad and online reservation was quite smooth. And I read other reviews, seems like it's mixed. And some people did get good food there. I don't know whether they changed chef that night, because I couldn't see any positive from my dish.
author: Pink M.

description:
Things must be all over the place here. Reviews are very inconsistent. Here's my take:
 
The service was good.
Friendly staff. 

The food was bland.
Fried cod needed something...salt, flavor?
The bavette steak was unseasoned, chewy and the odd choice of raw cabbage on top didn't help.

For the price, there's plenty of other places to try. Didn't find this a good value for money.
author: Bam B.

description:
We came here as a group for a farewell to our friend who is traveling abroad..
Yet, we all unfortunately regretted picking this place !

Although the bar looked nice with some decorations and catchy lighting, the food was a total disaster on that side. The portions were extremely small and will NOT fulfill your appetite at all. I would have forsaken that if the taste was worth it; yet, it tasted pretty average.
DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT ORDERING THE MUSSELS... They were extremely small in size and are not even suitable for an appetizer.
The only good thing was the Ile Flotante dessert; pretty much the only thing worth having in the whole place.
Waiters had an attitude which seemed unpleasant; yet, we disregarded it since it was our friend's farewell.
All in all, I will most probably never go to this place again and would not recommend any of my friends to do so.
author: Amro E.

description: We stumbled on this wine bar while attending an event on the same block.  Wow!  What a find!  The wine was excellent, and the menu had some wonderful small plates to share.  Along with the cheese plate and charcuterie platter which you would expect from a wine bar, they had a tarte that was out of this world delicious.  The deviled eggs were quite a nice addition to the menu, and the fries were heavenly.  Service here was fantastic.  I would most definitely come here again.
author: J. S.

description: Brought a group of clients and colleagues to Aquitaine and had one of the best experiences ever! From setting up the party with Andrew to the last bite of the airy meringue dessert called Il Flotant, it was divine. Great for groups (they have a private room) or intimate dinners, the ambiance, pro service and delicious food is unbeatable here.
author: Dayna C.

description:
Came here for lunch.  Not bad, not great.  Probably will just come here for wine next time.

Had deviled eggs appetizer.  Nothing special.  Could live without.  Only one of the three halves had one tiny cube of duck on it.  What's the point if you can't eat it with duck on each one?  Won't order again.

Had the burger.  Meat was awesome.  Cooked medium rare perfectly and seasoned well.  But why serve it on a ciabatta bun?  So now I have this great piece of meat on a thick, dry, tough piece of bread.  Try creating a bread recipe from scratch and make something buttery and awesome.  Might eat again.

The fries sucked imo.  What's to like about hard and hollow?  Won't eat again.

Probably won't be eating here again, but I do like the drinking atmosphere.  I have to try it again to make sure it wasn't just a fluke experience.
author: John M.

description: I ordered octopus and mussels appetizer. Guess what I found on my dish? No mussels. You know the show "Chopped"? and the chefs get pretty disappointed with the competitors who forgot to put a mystery ingredient? I was so disappointed. Never going back. What kind of a restaurant forgets to put an ingredient? The dish was called octopus and mussels. Not just OCTOPUS!
author: Vicky J.

description:
This establishment is located 50 feet from my office building's front door, so as I write this, I have to consciously think of all the reasons why I'm giving it what I'm giving BESIDES convenience...

There are lots of reasons:

- Wine: Tons of interesting wines. Obviously French varietals but I do want to say there are some Spanish wines too (maybe it's Basque?) and what's on the menu is always available.

- Decor and vibe: Dark woods, darker lighting. A bit of traditional French bistro with some rustic elements for accents. Wine cork lined bar. Music has chill vibes, usually downtempo and/or bossa nova. Of the many times I've been here, I've only seen it packed to the brim once-- during that time, it got a little noisy but hey, I stayed. I usually stay at the bar (well, it's closest to the wine...), but if you have a bigger party, there's always the semi-secret/unknown downstairs which would be a great place if you wanted to pull of a private party/gathering/work meeting.

- Staff: High knowledge of all those interesting wines and willing to share it if you ask. Ability to distinguish and offer wine offerings based on customer preferences. Also friendly, jovial, and attentive (but not overly so like in a stuffy restaurant).

- Food: can't say with much about entrees because I've never stayed for dinner, but there's a roast duck dish that comes out sizzling that I've always wanted to try.  Typically, I go there for happy hour, so the fries and mussels are solid, as is their excellent flash fried eggplant with celery/mint/plum sauce. Consistent.

-Value: For happy hour, they have a good deal for by-the-glass wine (I believe 2$ off), and most of the glasses end up being 5-10$. Quite obviously, even without the happy hour discount-- that is a top-notch deal in the FiDi.
author: Arexaurus R.

description: Went to Aquitaine for a quick dinner with a friend on a weekday after work. The place wasn't as crowded as I expected, which I was happy about because I was pretty hungry. We ordered the steak and potatoes, fried cod, fries, and molten chocolate cake. The fried cod wasn't anything special - a little on the bland side, to be honest, but the steak and potatoes were pretty good! The molten chocolate cake was so good, especially since I have a huge sweet tooth. The servers were all extremely friendly!
author: Sophie H.

description: I had the Escantoun Landais polenta and...(did I dream this?) some sort of avocado and octopus on toast (sorry, finally getting around to this review; was there weeks ago). Also tried bits of other folks' meals (fries in a wooden shoe, mussels) and two great bottles of wine.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Had the escargo in bone marrow- yum
A bottle of Bordeux that was reasonably priced 
Grilled calimari- not breaded and the best
Deviled eggs ****

Cute little place!  loved the wine glass chandelier and the service was excellent!
author: Adri H.

description:
Tried the duck reuben! I got it to-go. Well.. It was salty and delicious for the first bite, then it tasted burnt. The bread was black! The absolutely inedible kind of black.  Shame on the cook for serving burnt bread. Unacceptable! How hard is it to toast another piece? The restaurant had only three others at the bar, none of which were eating food. Its not like he was slammed and forgot my bread. I went back. I work in a kitchen myself so I know all too well the ins and outs of a lazy day-shift cook. I waltzed to the end of the bar which is by the kitchen and handed the cook my to-go box with the burnt bread showing.

 "Do you always serve burnt bread?" I said to him. 
He responded with, "Oh shit, I didn't see that! Sorry!" 

Of course you didn't, you just put mayo on that side with your EYES CLOSED.

I sat at the bar and the waitress noticed I was back. I told her I was served burnt bread and that it was all good because the cook was re-making it. She kindly offered me a drink on the house. 

All in all, that burnt bread cost them stars but the replacement and drink comp showed good customer service. I was still disappointed that the cook even allowed that to happen but hopefully I was the last person he served burnt bread because he did not get away with it this time. The sandwich is delicious but very rich. 

I peeped their menu and it looks like they have tons of amazing french food. I will be back to give them a chance to make those stars back!  I'm not done with you Aquitaine!
author: Audra H.

description:
I'm probably not their target audience, and if you're reading this review because you went to France and wanna know how it matches up, I don't know. I have never been to France and my requirements for wine are "Does it have alcohol?" and "Is it under six bucks?"

That being said, I needed to get some work done Christmas Eve, and I was in the area, so I stopped in. They were clearly ready to serve me some fancy wines (of which there are plenty) but I opted for the Konig Pilsner (because I'm on a budget of cheap and hatred) and fries.

When I said I wanted "the fries," I got a look like I had just taken off my shoe and began to gnaw on it. Perhaps I should have said "le fries."

Fittingly, the fries come in a dutch clog. It's very cute. The fries looked a lot better than they were, but their dipping sauce is delicious. Douse those babies and you got yourself a good time. It's statements like this why I am not considered classy in establishments like Aquitaine. 

The beer was delicious, too. The server came to my table and poured it for me whenever I was getting low. I don't know if he thought I was incapable, but I'm going to pretend that's how they do it in France and he thought a lady like me shouldn't have to pour her own beer. 

It makes sense that my biggest complaint would be about the price of fries. Le fries cost me $8. It was a sizable shoe-full, but eight dollars? A little outrageous for fries served in a clog. It's not like you get to keep the clog or anything.

I should probably go back and try some of their more traditional fare. When my number comes in, you'll be seeing me Aquitaine.
author: Sam D.

description: What a great ambiance and service! I sat at the bar, tried some wine and decided on this amazing Bordeaux. I paired it with a polenta dish mixed with grilled small tomatoes, parsley, basil, garlic drizzled in olive oil and some sort of amazing sauce. It was the best. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable. Love this place
author: Mina O.

description:
This place is really convenient in terms of it's proximity to my office (great for longer lunches), but unfortunately the service isn't great. 

I went here for a lunch and got the duck confit rubuen and my friend got the oysters and we each got fries and split the chocolate cake for dessert. The food was all perfectly fine (the rubuen was actually pretty good), but it took forever to get out of there. We went kind of late -- around 1 PM and the restaurant was mostly empty and the owner seemed to just sit at a table and look over his books while we waited to place our order and also when trying to get our check and pay. 

Only go here if you have plenty of time to spare!
author: Kim S.

description: Adorable! Great ambience, decently priced and yummy food, good service.
author: Makiko H.

description:
Fun atmosphere with great wine selection. The food smelled great, but I didn't have any. 

Apparently there is an area downstairs with couches too. 

I will add to my bookmarks to come back!
author: Leslie E.

description:
Wonderful wine selection but the top area is very cramped, especially if you're at the tall tables in the middle.  Service was solid, prompt and attentive enough. 

Good for Okcupid dates if it's semi casual  and you're both rushed downtown.
author: Patrick T.

description: Likely the worst French cuisine I have ever had in my life.  I give it two stars because they were willing to swap out my meal (went for a cheeseburger after grilled calamari was spiced horribly and even the cheeseburger was marginal on a stale white bun).  Service was friendly and attentive so at least they were trying.
author: Matt F.

description: A cute place downtown - unique wine selections from southern France - the semillon is tops. Expensive for sure, but lots of heart. Will go for lunch one day soon! A nice place for a low key after-work happy hour.
author: Andrew K.

description: T and I enjoyed a loud and lively dinner here in Thursday night.  Duck stew was fantastic - sort of like cassoulet but creamier and T had the burger, fantastic with very caramelized onions.
author: Wylie T.

description:
Really great wine list with lots of wines from the region...not enough from Cahor or the Bergerac regions as far as I could tell in dim light. Great ambiance. Apparently there's a lower area (downstairs) that is nice but I didn't venture there.

Service was slow, but it wasn't a crazy busy night so I'm not sure what was up. Perhaps my waiter was newer. He didn't suggest things I could try, being this was my first visit - just didn't seem to have much of an opinion on the menu. When I tell a waiter it's my first visit, I not so secretly hope that they'll tempt me with everything on the menu that they think rocks. Didn't happen. 

Dinner menu is divided into lots of small and large plates. Asked my server if what I was ordering (crispy cod) was enough for an entree and he said yes...but also asked if I wanted to start with something like a salad  (which seemed confusing since he implied that my order was sufficient) but when it arrived (quite some time later), it wasn't big enough in the end and I was left feeling like I needed more. I considered a cheese plate but decided to just order a dessert and call it a night. The fish was good, light, crispy, but it didn't strike me as being regional cuisine (and I've been to Aquitaine). Sadly, I'd ordered the plat du jour (polenta with shellfish) but they had run out. That would have probably been closer to regional.

Dessert was a pair of Canelle de Bordeaux with some sort of prune compote (?) and a whipped cream infused with yet  more prune. I liked the Canelle, but not the fruit stuff it came with. I think I had a bit of an allergic reaction to something in it so I just scraped off the fruit and focused on the pastry. I know that the region is known for it's prunes, but this was a miss to me. Also, I'm not sure that they should reheat the canelle as they did - they become a bit rubbery when you do this.

I'll definitely be back and give it another try though. I could easily have given this place 5 stars if they ironed out a few things...and would have preferred to have given them 3.5 (rather than 4) but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.
author: Linda C.

description:
The service here was pretty good, waiter was attentive and brought water refills whenever he needed to. The atmosphere here was not bad; I came for a late lunch so there weren't many people around; it was quiet and since I came only with one other friend, the small tables were nice and quaint.

I ordered the duck cassoulet, but the portion was pretty small and  sausage that came with it had almost no taste. The duck and the beans were pretty good, but I don't think the food overall was anything to rave about. Probably just ordered the wrong thing.
author: Raymond Y.

description:
I've been to Aquitaine a couple times now and I will be going back a lot. It has great service, great food, and an amazing wine selection.  The staff is very friendly and knowledgable about their wines.  They are very helpful.

I'm very excited for this new spot
author: Jennifer C.

description: After four times and eaten in aquitaine all my experiences were very good and nice, "The Cave" is the best place for special events and the food is delicious the cassoulet is the best and I had in a long time and ribs With fig are delicious the best wine of the South West of France. The service is very good ,Andrew is the best person to consult on wines to accompany your meal ask him for the best selection of wines will surprise you.
author: Eusebio P.

description:
I'm a fan more for the ambiance of this cute little spot in FiDi. I came here last week for HH, and was pleasantly surprised that a charming little spot like this existed close by my work! 

The wines were decent as was the food. I think I was a little disappointed with the duck popcorn since it was super greasy and made the popcorn soggy really quick. Other than that the prosciutto skewers and cheese plates were on point! Service was excellent.

TIP: They have a more private room downstairs for company HH's or larger group parties!
author: Kristen C.

description:
I loved everything! 

Favorite was the crispy flatbread and the caramelized eggplant. Get the meringue dessert!!
author: Jeri C.

description: We enjoyed the moules and a charcuterie platter. All in all very decent. Enjoyed the wines as well.
author: Mr.x T.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the duck Reuben sandwich (duck confit, pastrami, Swiss, pickled onions, rémoulade) and I don't think $14 is too much to pay for a sandwich that only comes with simply, lightly dressed greens. Those greens are a nice cut to the richness of the confit and the excellent, oleaginous (in a good way) bread. The thin slice of pastrami was almost crisp on its edges. This made for an excellent lunch; but glasses of wine from $10-$18 (I went with a $14 Pinot noir) makes this place a bit too pricey for lunch. I wouldn't even necessarily recommend this place for a drink before dinner elsewhere; but if you're in the area and in the mood, you'll do fine. 3.5 rounded up.
author: Brski B.

description: Leo was an amazing host!  Such a wonderful experience.  Definitely will make this place a stop on my next trip to the city.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Excellent wines and very attentive service.  I have been to Aquitaine 3 times now and each time was a delight.  The food is superb, the setting comfortable and really like the decor and extra attention to detail, yes, even including the chalk board in the bathroom!  

I met with a friend yesterday and, as he was running late, worried that we wouldn't be eating.....andrew assured us that he would take care of us and make sure we were happy before we left which indeed we both were.  The chicken raddichio salad was perfect as were the suggested wines, and the floating island desert topped off the meal.  we will definitely be back!  thank you!
author: Alison M.

description:
If you are in a hurry or don't like to read I will sum it up for you - Aquitaine is fantastic, go there!

I had the good fortune to live almost five years in Europe, some of that time living in Paris and traveling throughout France. From this experience I developed an appreciation of French food culture. The French have a fundamental understanding that most of us Americans lack - good food comes from good materials and expert preparation. This is not fast, not easy, and not cheap.  When you consider all the costs and challenges of going into the restaurant business it is remarkable that anyone takes the plunge; especially to bring high quality expertly prepared food to a sometimes unappreciative American audience. Fortunately for all of us Laurent Manrique and Andrew Fidelman have taken that risk and created a wonderful oasis of French cuisine at 175 Sutter Street in San Francisco.

Manrique comes from a rural town in the south of France near Toulouse. He is classically trained and a Michelin starred chef. His resume is extensive with projects that span both coasts of the USA. Manrique's partner at Aquitane is Andrew Fidelman, an American, born in Detroit, who became a wine connoisseur and sommelier. Together they form an impressive team.

When we arrived at Aquitaine we entered a welcoming bistro style restaurant where the casually dressed diner feels comfortable. This is in keeping with the decor of French country restaurants that serve a local population. We immediately saw the impressive array of wines proudly displayed that gives the impression of having arrived in a great wine cellar. But just wait till you see what comes out of that kitchen. Unbeknownst to us, co-owner Andrew Fidelman would be our waiter.

We started with the Beet Salad, a sumptuous combination of beets, kale, pear, and walnuts, covered in a thin blanket of smoked duck. For the main course we ordered the Aquitaine signature dish - Braised Lamb Shanks for 2. The meat was so flavorful and fall-off-the-bone tender with an accompanying broth that is its own soup course. Ask for bread. You don't want the broth to go to waste. Andrew Fidelman suggested the Caramelized Eggplant with mint that is a perfect pairing to the lamb. This is French country comfort food at its absolute best. Fidelman selected for us a moderately priced French wine that was a very nice accompaniment to the meal.

Everything was superbly prepared and the portions very ample which unfortunately gave us no room to enjoy the sumptuous selection of deserts. But we didn't mind because we now have a great excuse to go back.

The bill came to $113 for the two of us, but considering the quality and authenticity of the French cooking is well worth it. Far cheaper than a trip to France, and you still get the real thing!

And if you ever happen to be in Paris, visit Le Grappillon restaurant at 32 Rue Tiquetonne in the 3rd arrondissement. That is my other most favorite place in the world for French comfort food.

But since I won't be going to Paris anytime soon, the Aquitaine absolutely fills my need for that essential taste of France. We are so looking forward to our next visit!
author: Christopher H.

description:
I visited this place twice: for lunch and for dinner.
Both times I didn't like entries: crispy cod (small piece of cod) and salmon (small piece of salmon with regular salad). It was so ordinary! It doesn't worth this money.
My husband took steak and it was awful! Stuffed potato with 4 thin slices of meat. It's not even a steak!

Everything else was good: wine, atmosphere, service. 
If you'd like to take a few glasses of wine - this place is good, but I do not recommend you to order food there.
author: Kate S.

description: Friend and I came here on a whim to quickly eat some French food. The idea of a "quick" meal was rapidly dismissed. The place has an awesome atmosphere! Not too loud, but not too quiet either. I highly recommend halibut (might have spelled it wrong) and their chocolate dessert. Definitely coming back to try the steak. :)
author: Ken S.

description: Great French restaurant with amazing wines and amazing food. The service is great too! Will definitely come back soon!
author: Andrea M.

description:
I had dinner here with two others.  The food was good and everyone in my party left with a happy belly, but what really made this place stand out was the service. 

Our waiter was great at recommending wine for us, and knowing which wine would pair well with which courses. At the end he even gave us a sample of a delicious dessert wine. He was great at being attentive and knowledgeable.
author: Kate V.

description: Great wine bar and restaurant. Food is amazing, lots of upbeat atmosphere. Downstairs is quiet and a nice place to hang out with a couple of friends and socialize. Highly recommend trying this new neighborhood soon to be favorite!
author: Joy M.

description: Nice wine selection.  Mussels were a bit undercooked, but polenta with mushrooms and fries were great!  Nice cozy ambience.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
3.5 stars. Came here after ice skating with a friend of mine. It was pretty empty when we showed up around 8:45pm on a Friday, with maybe like 6 other people inside.

They tried to pressure us to eat stuff! Like two times. I found it a little strange... maybe they make all their money from food or something. It didn't make me feel super comfortable.

The wines were good though. I started with an aperitif called Porthos, which was Lillet, white wine, and candied apple slice of some sort. It was very sweet, but also very refreshing. I tried a bit of my friend's white, and was very drinkable and crisp. I later had a Rose called Negrette. It was not very sweet, but had a bit of bite, but was still very, very good.

They were sometimes slow to respond to us at the bar, and when I was asking for the check.

Overall, decent.
author: Michael W.

description: Oh my lord. This has to be the best French restaurant I have been too. Andrew was amazing and helped recommend what to eat and drink. We had the asparagus appetizer that was to die for. It was amazing!! Then we had the lamb dish for two. The sauce and lamb was cooked to perfection. We ordered two bread baskets just to soak up the sauce. It was out of this world. Highly recommend
author: Mike P.

description: Went here for a work lunch. Was good for lunch but food was a little boring. I ordered a cod salad and was very basic. The French fries are delicious.
author: Yasi N.

description: Heard you were good but left with a disappointment... Good pink sangria. Light & delicious. However, the mussels were so so. About 5 of my mussels were not opened so I was afraid to consume it(probably not fresh). The fries were okay (huge portion so sharing is a must)
author: Ann L.

description:
Great wine and the French fries are outstanding. My MLT wrap (mushroom, lettuce and tomato) was about a 6.  Mostly not a big iceberg lettuce fan which is what it's wrapped in.

Service was tops and right now, it's an undiscovered gem. Probably not for long though.
author: Kevin W.

description: Thanks to their excellent service guy, smoked duck was dropped all over my clothes. Otherwise meals were good..
author: Ceyhun D.

description: A gem of a restaurant and dining experience.  So much so I almost don't want to share and let the secret out. Our food was fabulous, salmon with caramelized eggplant, mussels with pomme frites and spectacular wine pairings as well. Truly a unique dining experience. Genuine interest and care was given to our meal and to us. So glad we stopped in! Thank you, Andrew!
author: Monica B.

description:
This review is for the service rather than for the food. But then again it's kind of hard to review the food if they don't serve you at all! We had reservations for 1.15 pm and were seated outside. We were given menus and then left to our own devices. No one appeared so after a good 20 minutes of waiting we walked off.

Have added a star to what should be a 1 star review because in fairness the restaurant called us to apologize and asked us to come back. However, it was lunch on a weekday so this sort of service simply doesn't cut it.
author: Chetan G.

description:
Let me start out by saying that I have been here twice, and while the food was good (tapas-style, light dinner, great for sharing) and the ambiance was very nice, I will not come back due to the service.

On the first occasion, I went with a group of about 6 women for happy hour and dinner.  The only thing that was off during this visit was one of the servers was not very friendly - any time we ordered or asked for anything, he just seemed annoyed.  We had such a good experience the rest of the night, I let that part of the visit go and couldn't wait to return.

About a month later, I went back with a group of 4 different friends.  When I got there, the place was pretty empty so I was checking out the different seating options.  I changed my mind twice within the minute the server (the SAME server who seemed rude during visit #1 mind you) was seating me, and I prefaced the second switch with "sorry to be annoying, but..." - he replied with "don't worry, you're like all my customers..."  GREAT.  When my first friend got there, and ordered the same drink as me (one of the happy hour specials), he rolled his eyes.  The only reason I can think he might have done this is because we were ordering a happy hour special which was less expensive than their other wines; otherwise, I have no idea.

Another employee at the restaurant, who I recognized to be the manager from my first visit, came to take our food order a while later.  We wanted a cheese plate, and since the menu states "choose 3 cheeses" but does not list the options, my friend asks him what the choices are.  He replies, in an incredibly snarky tone, "you want me to tell you ALL of them?" and she says "yes."  So he lists them all out quickly, all of them being very french terms which were things most people probably wouldn't know, and didn't even explain what they were.  When we looked at him with blank expressions, he said, "see, that didn't help did it?" To which we replied "no."  The result, he picked us out a plate of his choosing.

I'm sad that things didn't turn out that great during my last visit, because I probably would have been a regular at this place.  I just don't like spending my time and money after a hard days' work at a place where I can't be comfortable.  Otherwise, the ambiance is so nice (feels like you're in Paris), and the food/drinks are good.  I just wish the customer service was up to par.
author: Gina M.

description: Amazing....wasn't crazy about first wine I got. I think he's a manager or owner....totally turned the night around and I had such a great time with my bf! He said he just wants us to enjoy the night and we absolutely did!
author: Hyun B.

description: Great French bistro food in downtown.  The tarte flambee was the highlight of my meal.  Not quite what I expected from the name, but it was a delicious app. Also had the cassoulet, which admittedly may have been a poor choice.  While the food was wonderful, it was a bit too heavy for me with the abundance of white beans.  Overall, I had a great meal and would happy return.
author: Josh Q.

description: Andrew was an amazing host. The lamb shank and polenta were great. We tried the very popular fries which were good but not for us. Our sever Leo was excellent and the chef visited our table. I highly recommend visiting this spot on a Saturday night. It is less busy than the FiDi crowds and still excellent!
author: Nathan B.

description: went there last night with some friends and we loved it! the food was delicious, great wine selection and awesome service. We want to try everything on the menu so we'll be back! :-)
author: Olvido M.

description: We came for the wine and stayed for dinner because the place was perfect. The eggplant was to die for. My husband loved the beat salad, too. So glad we dropped in. The owner, Andrew, was on the spot and genial.
author: Caragh O.

description: Got sick from the scallops.  Avoid at all costs!
author: Merryl K.

description:
A very good food with an equally excellent service. 
Surprised Friday afternoon is not crowded(like other FiDi locations) and was able to get seated quickly. 
Food is affordable and not pricey at all. Entree item Polenta is light and refreshing. Highly recommend.
author: Mali S.

description: Ate here last night and had a great time.  Super service. Owner and staff made us feel like we were the only ones in the place.  Lamb shanks are amazing and desserts were too.  Will definitely remember this place next time we're in the city.
author: Bill C.

description: Food was great and staff very friendly and hospitable.  The only issue we had was the table next to us was very, very noisy and as a result it was quite annoying...the woman's laugh would bring down the roof of this cozy restaurant.
author: S W.

description: Waiter was so rude, my wife started crying! We sat down and asked what paired will with duck, and the waiter with neck tattoo, promptly told my wife that she needs to pick her own wine, and walked off. Terrible experience. We walked out.
author: Patrick S.

description:
So gracious and accommodating! 

It looks very small on the outside, but the inside is roomy, and the atmosphere is charming.

Really nice wine and sparkling picks. Great burger, and the specials looked awesome (will have to try next time). The Dijon is spicy just like the bistros in France too! 

Definitely a great downtown stop!
author: Kelly D.

description: Had a wonderful ladies luncheon with my coworkers at your establishment last week...the food was great & the service was excellent! One problem...the chairs were very uncomfortable. The wooden frame put pressure on the back of my thighs & made my legs go numb. Just wanted to let you know...
author: Susie E.

description: We had a wonderful Saturday evening here as a party of 6 (word to the wise that Saturdays are much less crowded than weekdays at these Financial District spots). It was nice not to be overwhelmed by crowds and noise. The atmosphere was charming, and we even got to check out the private room downstairs that can be used for special occasions. The service was excellent, and the food was awesome. I recommend the scallops, brussel sprouts tempura, spiced fries, and creatively-devilled eggs. Yum. Would definitely like to go back to this spot!
author: Kate R.

description: Very authentic French bistro with the flavors of Southern France. Great food, reasonable prices. Outstanding and real. Not to be missed.
author: Bfa F.

description: Trying this place because of the write up about the Ile flottante, hope it's great, food is okay so far.
author: Ring Leader D.

description: I was looking for something small and light to eat and this place hit the spot. Their wine is good too. Come here and you won't regret it.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
My girlfriend came here with a friend today. The staff, clearly thinking her and her Japanese friend were tourists, automatically charged them an automatic 20% gratuity, $9 for a $4 order of fries, amongst other  billing discrepancies. Sad to see clear discrimination against "tourists". 

No thanks -- will avoid in the future.
author: Jory M.

description:
Still like this place a lot, I'm updating to say that it's also turning out to be very good for lunch.  We are starting to go pretty frequently from the office.  Duck reuben sandwich, good salads, polenta, there is always a soup available.  If only I could drink at lunch it would be perfect.

Also updating to say that a place where you can buy the wine you really liked, at a discount?  Really nice touch.  Taking advantage of this!
author: Laura H.

description:
Service was fair.  Nothing outstanding.  its the food.  I ordered the crispy cod salad - over the top salty.  it has 3 times the dressing it needs and they put a mayo sauce right on the fish on the salad.  The salad became unnecessarily  heavy.  I was not able to finish it.  This should not be categorized as a salad.  The portion of salad was very small to begin with and just drowned in salty sauce.  More greens, less salt and 1/3 the dressing would have saved this dish. Conceptually I appreciated it but taste wise I could not finish it.  The other dishes were over salted as well.  DO NOT OVER SALT, THERE IS NO GOING BACK.  I CAN ALWAYS ADD SALT IF I NEED TO.

They do not try hard enough.  Comparable restaurants in the vicinity do a much better job in all categories.  Aquitaine is not worth the value paid.
author: Marcia P.

description: Used to be good when it first opened, but the last time in here the mussels were terrible, the waiter didn't bring the fries till the end of the meal and they were un-edible.  They forgot the side dish to my friend's meal.  All around the service and food were not good.  Sorry, we won't be going back.  Bummed out, because we used to like going here.
author: Pele N.

description: super cute little cafe/wine bar in SF .. just stopped by for a drink before a dinner.  I came here really for the deviled eggs, which were good.  The service was exceptional.  I like this not too stuffy wine bar where everyone was super chill friendly and helpful.  I didn't try their main dishes, but it all looked delish.  I'd definitely come back again for a happy hour
author: Stephanie C.

description: Food was addicting. The chef came out to greet us and the bartender was hilarious. Service was spectacular. Sexy lighting and adorable rustic decor. What's there to complain about? Other than I can't get enough of their polenta. YUM!
author: Nelly Y.

description: Stopped in with a friend for a glass of wine and ended up having two plus lots of their amazing food!  What a great space.  Will definitely go back.  Actually, I think I want to book it for a private event.  Will keep you posted if I do.
author: Gary S.

description: Such a hidden Gem! Great service all around...Delicious wine and decadent apps and desserts. We had a party of 20 down stairs and it was the perfect intimate setting!
author: staci H.

description: I visited the place while traveling. To me it wasn't just another wine bar; I felt like I was visiting my friends. Great food - down to earth but interesting wine list, and amazing staff!
author: Rozita N.

description: Feels very european--nice atmosphere and interiors.  Food is really good. I had a steak sandwich and shared fries with the table.  The sandwich was DELISH, and the fries also. Had a hit of parsley and not oversalted. The wait staff is attentive, and I really liked that the manager went around to every table to ask diners about their food, etc. and also kept a watchful eye to assist with the waiter. Did not have wine as this was lunchtime, but looked over the wine list and it seems quite extensive. I plan to take advantage of the nice weather and sit at their outside tables one evening after work and have a glass of wine or two and people watch.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Stopped in after work for wine and a snack. The bartender was super attentive and helpful, forgot to ask his name though. I wanted to try something new wine wise and the bartender suggested a wonderful white, petite manseng I believe it was called. It was lovely, he let me try a little before I committed to a glass which I always appreciate. I ordered the escargot, which were very different from what I was expected. It was extremely delicious, although for $14 I think they could have included more snails. I think I only got one or two in the bone, the rest were mushrooms, Really great dish though. I really love this spot. I want to go back to try more food for sure.
author: Emily S.

description:
My boyfriend and I stopped by on Monday night to check out this new wine bar/restaurant near the Crocker Galleria.  One of the BEST things about this place is the lounge area downstairs, filled with couches and armchairs - it would make a really nice, intimate place to come for a date or hang out with friends.  I don't think I know of any other space quite like it in the downtown area.  I highly recommend checking it out.

Upstairs, Aquitaine is nicely decorated with thoughtful details like chandeliers made of wine glasses.  The place has a cozy atmosphere, and the bartender and waitstaff were very friendly.  There is a superb selection of wines.  We sat at the bar and ordered the Cabillaud (black cod) with Piperade, which was excellent - rustic and flavorful, and a generous portion.  The mussels also came in a surprisingly large pot with garlic toast.  There were so many we couldn't finish.  A very pleasant  experience overall.  We'll be back!
author: H. A.

description: No need for a return trip. The food was okay, but not great. I had the steak salad and the meat was tough and several pieces couldn't be chewed. The iced tea was flavored, and tasted okay, but it would have been nice to know it was flavored ahead of time. The lighting was awkward and kind of disorienting. Not surprised the place wasn't very packed during the Christmas season (in general, there are tons of business lunches during the weeks heading up to Christmas, but this place was only half full).  Nothing awful, but nothing very good.
author: Jeff C.

description: We just had a fabulous dinner at this restaurant. The food was excellent, interesting and well priced. Intimate setting, great ambience and excellent service. The pizza appetizer (flat bread) was unique and delicious. The salmon was perfectly prepared and melted in your mouth. We ordered a variety of entrees and sides and all were excellent. Strong wine list. Put this restaurant on your list and visit soon. You will not be disappointed. There is also a separate facility for a group dinner of 10-14.
author: Susan C.

description: Beautiful ambiance, and the severs were really nice. I went in during their happy hour period and nothing on the menu looked like it can satisfy my hunger, the server noticed this and was kind enough to ask if the chef could prepare something off the dinner menu and they accommodated. The food was great, I ordered the Hanger steak and a separate order of their fries. These fries are amazing. This also seems like a great place to have wine with friends.
author: Ammir V.

description: Very small menu and at 8:30 they already ran out of 3 of our choices. The food was good although lacking more french specialities.
author: Tooraj B.

description: Having just left this amazing restaurant - this is one you don't want to miss.  Cool vibe - intimate setting and Andrew the owner was so personable and made you feel like it was really all about you!  The salmon was outstanding as were the side dishes he helped us to choose.  Topped off with two great desserts we shared.  It was a perfect evening.  Can't wait to come back!!
author: Anne R.

description:
Pros
- good service - attentive and friendly

Cons
- small portions
- French restaurants are not French unless they provide bread!

For the most part, it was just okay. The quality of the food was okay, no one at the table was raving or ranting about the food (table ordered: mussels, butter salad, duck beet salad, soup, prawns).  

Wouldn't go out of my way to eat dinner here again probably.
author: Victoria K.

description: This place is adorable!! Unfortunately I did not have the opportunity to dine here, so my review is only for the coffee. I was visiting SF for the weekend and stopped by here to have some quick coffee. I know this is a wine bar, but OMG their coffee was seriously amazing. I had a double espresso, and the people I was with had Americanos. I don't think I've ever had coffee outside of Europe that tasted so delicious. Cute little spot in the financial district, perfect to sit outside and have some wine or coffee. When I'm back in town I'm definitely going to try their food too! Would recommend this place to anyone in SF! Very enjoyable :-)
author: Food L.

description: I didn't have much in the way of food (the duck charcuterie was very small for the price, but yummy), but the wine and service were great. The ambiance was outstanding, though, and would make me return again and again.
author: Monika M.

description: Really great, small place. Did dinner here. Staff were fantastic. Wine was great. Had the eggplant, deviled eggs, calamari, garlic soup, duck prosciutto, and the molten cake. All was delectable. Will be going back.
author: Cameron B.

description: I'm reviewing this purely from a bar perspective since I haven't tried the food. And to be honest I'm torn about reviewing it because I don't want to let the secret out that this a great place for happy (wine) hour because it's NOT packed like all the other bars in the FiDi/Downtown. I came here to grab drinks with a friend and we were able to sit at the bar and hear each other talk. It's very cosy and cute.
author: Clogozm C.

description: Buon Jour! They've brought the French countryside to San Fran and it's c'est si bon! Yummy hot plates of great food & such friendly Staff. Perfect for sharing over fab wines after work and found out they are serving lunch now. Been 3 times & will return. Don't miss the lower level comfy warm lounge - it's so unique! Had a date there & did after work biz get together. I love this new addition.
author: Guido B.

description: Had a date here for wine and hh appetizers. Wine by the glass was terrible, and the $1 deviled eggs were overpowered by vinegar and inedible.
author: Alex N.

description: Stopped by on Friday which was quite lively both upstairs and in the downstairs lounge(cozy and  romantic). The patrons were a mix of locals and tourists. Vibe was fun and friendly. We had the mussels which was a HUGE portion, definitely made to share which paired well with a bottle of bordeaux blend.
author: Maria C.

description:
Came for a business drink and bite. Cute and trendy wine bar that serves tapas and dinner. We shared the Serrano ham, shrimp, crispy cod and Iles Flottantes for dessert. 
Out of everything, i'd like the Serrano ham the best. Everything else was average.

The Iles Flottantes dessert is light and good. It's a slightly firm meringue texture. i didn't care for the tart tasting drizzle they topped the dessert with. The flavor seemed to clash with the meringue. Overall it was good for someone who likes that texture and doesn't want a heavy dessert.
author: Dolls P.

description: Hubby and I went for dinner based on the "Pomme Frites in a shoe" being on the 100 best things to eat in SF list. I don't know who wrote that list, but it wouldn't make my top 100. Maybe they thought it was novel that it came in a wooden Dutch clog and that clouded their view, but the fries were dry and not very tasty at all. Certainly not worthy of a spot on that list, or any other list for that matter. Hubby and I started with deviled eggs and the beet salad. The deviled eggs are heavy on the mustard and have a bite to them. I kind of liked it, but for some that might not love mustard, that might not sit well. The beet salad was tasty, but drowning in dressing. Hubby got the Bavette steak with Roquefort sauce  and I got the salmon for dinner. My husband said the steak was chewy but he enjoyed his meal overall. I tried one of his smoked potatoes and thought it had a lovely smokiness to it and was one of the tastier things in our meals. My salmon was cooked well but, again, the dish was just swimming in sauce. This time in a butter sauce and I felt like I must have eaten about 1000 calories of butter. After all that butter in my sauce, I couldn't stomach dessert, so we passed on anything else. Overall I would say it was good, but not great. I'm still scratching my head on the fries....
author: Goldi J.

description: A fair-sized group from my company walked in on a Friday evening to celebrate our newest additions to the team, and the people at Aquitaine were so accommodating.  They gave us a a place to group, helped us pick out wines & food, and took great care of us.  Next time we'll be smarter and call ahead and reserve some space in the basement.  Great place!
author: Stacy A.
