description: Amazing service and ambiance. The wine selection was excellent as were the recommendations for wines. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. We enjoyed the mussels, salmon, and lamb, but above all, the personal attention and thoughtfulness of all of the staff set this place apart.
author: Teresa B.

description: the chicken salad is yummy and a good sized portion. also like the fries. the veggie salad (even if you add a protein) is very small...not good enough to eat alone as an entree
author: Musetta S.

description: Amazing meal!!! Never had escargot in a soup .... But an experience you need to try by ordering the Spring garlic soup... Loved it. I also ordered the caramelized eggplant, great flavor and texture . Lastly, had the Salmon... Cooked exactly as I ordered ... Medium rare ... Crispy on the outside and moist beyond belief on the inside.
author: Kellie T.

description:
The wine is all-out wonderful, the bar is homestyle unpretentious and charming.

You can't go wrong with the Negrette or the Malbec, start with the Negrette though.

Great pricing, especially for a wine bar in an area that charges roughly four dollars for an espresso shot during the day!

Don't forget the food either - oh my goodness, do not forget the food.
Real rustic french style food, not overly rich but not skimping on the quality in any way. The smaller snack food is served in Dutch wooden clogs - how rustic is that?

Great for easy company, or to relax an up tight date.
author: Tracy Z.

description: BE AWARE! I was there with my girlfriend celebrating her birthday. I left cash tips on the table, the restaurant ended up adding their own tips to my credit card. Of course I disbuted and got refund.
author: Jane L.

description: I wish I could send Berna on a flight to France with no return trip...since there are places there that will satisfy you.  This place is AWESOME.  My coworker and I flew in from Denver for a business conference.  We were staying in Union Square and decided to take a walk around the town. We decided on finding on wine bar and, somehow, within 1 block, we ran into Aquitaine.  We each had a glass a wine and a appetizer, which was unbelievable.  We were thinking of heading somewhere else for dinner and I suggested we stay there.  We got a bottle of wine and my buddy ordered a chicken dish and I ordered the onglet steak with sauce.  OH MY GOD!  Best dish I've ever had. We came back the next day for lunch...the onglet steak sandwich and duck confit sandwich...SO GOOD.   This is, sincerely, the best place I've ever eaten.   The chef has a Michelin rating and he is humble and sat next to us to eat.  I can't wait to take my wife there.
author: Jesse T.

description: I wanted to like this place because it had a happy hour, but it was just so-so. I've eaten at a lot of French bistros in the US and in France, and I will not be returning to this one. The food preparation and even the full wine list was disappointing. It would probably be okay if I didn't know how good bistro food tastes. There are so many better options in the area, especially for French bistro food.
author: Cathy P.

description: Best roast duck in SF. Great atmosphere and wonderful service. The wine pairing, a suggestion from the owner, was spot on and there was not attempt at gouging us. Highly recommended.
author: Shawerma M.

description: very cute décor and you feel like you are not near work while at Aquitaine but I didn't love anything I ate.   deviled eggs were so-so, fries weren't bad but they were spiced up and thicker (I like thin, crispy, salty no spice fries) and polenta with mushrooms was good but I don't need to eat it again.
author: Wakako U.

description: So this is based on just drinks and service! Ambience wise it is fabulous and the owner was super friendly when we entered. Having said that, I am disappointed to say (and yes been to france numerous times) that our particular server (blonde lady) was pretty cold/snooty and at one point didn't bring out the wine so another server was kind enough to do that! Not saying we need constant over the top service BUT a smile here and there and warm feeling of wanting to engage with us would be nice. I hope that the  server  warms up  a bit because it really changed my review so I hope the owner does read this! Overall great wines, great foods and a charming piece of france in FIDI. Merci :)
author: sue c.

description: The place gives a French appeal with the decor, service, and great food. Don't forget to try the Caramelized Eggplant and the Petatou. Overall, awesome place.
author: Namit J.

description: A good place to hang out. The food is decent, I will stick with appetizers and maybe desserts.
author: ZW N.

description: Stopped in here on a recent business trip to SF.  I enjoy seeking out these types of places that try and bring authentic cuisine to new areas.  Great selection of wines from the southwest of France.  Definately a new experience.  The cassoulette was excellent.
author: John S.

description: Aquitaine is a little gem in San Francisco. It has a casual atmosphere with delicious food! The specials are always phenomenal. The owner has always been friendly and attentive to his customers. If you enjoy French food, this is the place that is a must to visit.
author: Robin I.

description: Food of Armagnac and Basque country. You have to admire any place with roots enough to offer Floc de Gascogne by the glass. Tasty food in a very casual cafe' atmosphere. Good confit and mussels, delicious fresh pea soup and cheesy "escouton" (polenta) with roasted tomatoes, extremely addictive seared calamari with lots of parsley, salt and smoked espelette pepper. Fun wine list with lots to discover from Gascogne, Gaillac, Madiran and other parts of SW France.
author: C M.

description: Its this part of the year where 7x7 SF posts their famous list of " 100 things you have to eat in SF  before you die ". And off course its never the same stuff again, its always different. Am a caveman ( on the paleo diet wagon ) but I do bing once in a while and when I do it has to be exceptional. So most likely its going to be on 7x7's list. This is what happened recently I felt like french fries and these guys have one of the best I ever tasted. They serve it in a Netherlands's wooden looking shoes , but the best part is the fries , its goooood! But the entree I got did not hot it on the spot. I had high expectations, and off-course it was duck breast because inda place we eating FRENCH! The meat of the duck felt like its reheated ( cooked a week ago ) , very very cold. It wasn't the waiters fault  , because that was the best part of the experience the waiters where very friendly. It was the chef's to have served something like this. I heard they had good duck ruben sandwich , but they serve it only during lunch .Not  if am ever going back to try that.
author: Sulaiman B.

description: Super!! Even though incredibly busy, looked after, great wine, food amazing and really happy - will return for sure!
author: Adam S.
